summary: This is an email chain from August 2019 between FBI personnel regarding a summary of Epstein personnel, likely for creating a manifest. It shows internal FBI coordination on the Epstein case shortly after his arrest.

persons.name: ASAC New York Field Office Criminal - Branch C
persons.context: Recipient of an email from 'Ib' regarding Epstein personnel and the creation of a manifest.

persons.name: SSA - Squad C-20 Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking
persons.context: Sender of an email on August 7, 2019, with an attached summary of Epstein personnel, asking for review of accuracy.

events.title: Summary of Epstein personnel prepared
events.description: An SSA from the Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad sends a summary of Epstein personnel to an ASAC for review.
personsInvolved: SSA - Squad C-20 Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking
ASAC New York Field Office Criminal - Branch C

events.title: Manifest preparation coordination
events.description: FBI personnel ('Ib') indicates they will address questions in the morning and then put out a list to be used for a manifest.
personsInvolved: ASAC New York Field Office Criminal - Branch C

keyFacts: The FBI was actively coordinating on Epstein-related personnel matters in early August 2019, shortly after his arrest.
A 'manifest' was being prepared, suggesting logistical planning, possibly for transport, interviews, or operations.
The correspondence involves the FBI's Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad (C-20) and the New York Field Office Criminal Branch C.
The document indicates internal review processes for accuracy of information regarding Epstein personnel.
